meanings.definition: Think about (something) carefully before making a decision or reaching a conclusion.
meanings.sent1: She ponders her options before choosing a movie to watch.
meanings.sent2: He often ponders the meaning of life during his walks in the park.
meanings.sent3: The cat ponders whether to chase the laser pointer or take a nap.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, she ponders the fleeting nature of time.
meanings.sent5: Pondering the mysteries of the universe, he lost track of time.

meanings.sent1: He ponders the wise words of his grandfather.
meanings.sent2: After the argument, she sits quietly to ponder her actions.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel ponders the best route to reach the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The artist ponders the blank canvas before starting to paint.
meanings.sent5: Pondering the starry sky, he felt a sense of peace wash over him.

meanings.sent1: The team ponders the best strategy to win the game.
meanings.sent2: She ponders the pros and cons of moving to a new city.
meanings.sent3: The children ponders the idea of building a treehouse in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The professor ponders the implications of the new scientific discovery.
meanings.sent5: Pondering the ancient ruins, they imagined the lives of those who built them.
